dt: {bc}arrangement into specific proportion or relation and especially into artistic form
{bc}the production of type or typographic characters (as in photocomposition) arranged for printing

dt.t: the changing ethnic {wi}composition{/wi} of the city's population

dt: {bc}the qualitative and quantitative makeup of a chemical {a_link|compound}

dt.t: The two parties came to a {wi}composition{/wi}.

dt: {bc}a product of mixing or combining various elements or ingredients
{bc}a school exercise in the form of a brief essay

dt: {bc}a written piece of music especially of considerable size and {a_link|complexity}

dt: {bc}the quality or state of being compound

et: Middle English {it}composicioun{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}composicion{/it}, from Latin {it}composition-, compositio{/it}, from {it}componere{/it} {dx_ety}see {dxt|compose||}{/dx_ety}
shortdef: the act or process of composing; specifically : arrangement into specific proportion or relation and especially into artistic form
the arrangement of type for printing
the production of type or typographic characters (as in photocomposition) arranged for printing
